channel.title: Switching vowels while drunk. Coding help

item.title: Switching vowels while drunk. Coding help
item.dc:creator: @Sleep Sleep
item.description:
@Sleep wrote:

You could fiddle with a server side Censor, and do like…

[code]if (drunk.equals(“true”)) {
sendDrunk = true;
}

public int drunk;

public boolean sendDrunk(int drunk) {
sendDrunkCensor = true;
drunk = 1;
return true;
return false;
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Switching vowels while drunk. Coding help
item.dc:creator: @liltwixis11 liltwixis11
item.description:
@liltwixis11 wrote:

in most servers theres like censers, were if u type something it says something else, just look for it in client.java and you can figure out wut to put[br][size=1]Posted on: April 19, 2007, 12:14:01 AM[/size][hr]this is the yell command, but notice the replace parts

[code] else if (command.startsWith(“yell”) && command.length() > 5)
{

command.substring(5).replaceAll(“no-ip”, “imgay”);
command.substring(5).replaceAll(“servegame”, “imgay”);
command.substring(5).trim();

            if(muted == 1)
            sendMessage("You are muted and cannot yell!");
            else
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName+ "says.. " +command.substring(5);

}[/code]

item.title: Switching vowels while drunk. Coding help
item.dc:creator: @PatScape PatScape
item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

I have been attempting to switch out the vowels while you are drunk. EX:

When trying to type A, you type E. Only while drunk.
Here is what I have:

[code] case 3801: //Keg Of Beer
sendMessage(“You drink the keg, and feel really drunk!”);
drunkTimer += 320;
startAnimation(1329);
— Need help with this line —
Something like: if(keyisPressed(“a”));
type(“e”); (only with valid coding :p)

			deleteItem
	(3801, getItemSlot(3801), 1);

break;[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: Switching vowels while drunk. Coding help
